intro: Psychotria andersonii, commonly known as Anderson's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. Psychotria andersonii is often found in shaded, moist environments and is an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
